diagram_notes.content:
# Task:

Build a story reaching out to an open API and ending with a page that displays information referenced from your API request. This story must contain 4 of the 7 actions.

# Topic: Building using an open API Explainer 

This task involves leveraging multiple actions and reach out to service to build out our very own app. Using pages as a means to create an interface for our users.

When we reach out to a service using the HTTP Request action, we sometimes need a credential to have authorized access. An open API indicates a service that doesn't require us to be authorized to request actions be made. This is very typical with services that provide information that you can get.

Examples:
- [Free Dictionary](https://dictionaryapi.dev/)
- [Random dog](https://random.dog/)
- [Serialif Color](https://color.serialif.com/)
- [DiceBear](https://www.dicebear.com/how-to-use/http-api)
- [Faker API](https://fakerapi.it/en)

# Rubric:
✅ 4 different actions used
✅ HTTP request action configured to an open API
✅ Event transform action used for formatting data from the HTTP request action
✅ Page at the end of your story displaying formatted data
